course.title: Workstation Administration
course.description: This course provides a study of client system administration in a network environment. Topics include installing, monitoring, maintaining, and troubleshooting client operating system software and managing hardware devices and shared resources. Students gain hands-on experience in client operating system installation and basic administration of network workstations.

responseTime.email: 24 hours Monday-Thursday, Friday-Sunday emails responded to on Monday

required.title: uCertify Endpoint Administrator (MD-102)
required.note: No physical book. Purchase through ESCC bookstore

quizzes.description: Students will complete a quiz for each learning module

labs.description: Students will complete virtual labs through the uCertify course platform for each learning module

exams.description: Students will complete one proctored quiz, practice exams, and one final exam

discussions.description: Students will complete multiple discussion assignments as part of the learning modules

droppedGrades.note: Dropped scores are automatic and do not negatively affect final grade

assignments.submission: All assignments must be submitted by the given due date

penalties.lateWork: Zero for assignment not submitted by due date
penalties.extenuatingCircumstances: Considered if student provides notice at least 24 hours prior to due date, or within 24 hours after due date
penalties.documentation: Instructor may request documentation for proof of extenuating circumstances

finalGrades.location: Student Information Center via MyESCC link
finalGrades.access: Log into student account, not Canvas
finalGrades.communication: Final grades not given via email or phone

withdrawal.note: Withdrawal can affect eligibility for federal financial aid

academicHonesty.originalWork: All work must be your own and written exclusively for this course
academicHonesty.recycling: Students may not recycle or reuse work from another course

plagiarism.consequence: Zero on assignment, F for final course grade, reported to Dean of Instruction
plagiarism.inadvertent: Dealt with case-by-case basis, most result in failing grade on assignment

expectations: Accept personal responsibility for decisions and actions
Engage with course and complete assignments by due date
Ask questions and communicate with instructor as needed

schedule.lesson: Lesson 4: Planning and Managing Microsoft Intune

tutoring.access: Accept invitation in Canvas dashboard during first week

disclaimer: An addendum to this syllabus will be provided in the event that ESCC or an individual course should experience the need for an all in-person class to transition to remote instruction including synchronous, asynchronous or hybrid format due to pandemic or other event warranting the need for such plans.
